issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: nodeadmin-unpack-instance fails with 'No such device' error in MANAGED mode

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

{code}

comments.body: [~tsugawa], could you have a look into this? Is there a simple solution to the issue?
Is this a regression? Was migration in MANAGED mode operational in 4.2?
Migration with managed modes was tested in 4.2. [~shaon], correct me if I'm wrong.
Most of the migration tests were done in EDGE and VPC. I don't recall any migration test done with MANAGED* mode. I will try on 4.2.2 MANAGED mode and confirm.

Confirmed, for MANAGED mode migration was broken in 4.2.2 as well.

{noformat}
2016-06-27 16:04:12  INFO | [i-32080277] migration source preparing 10.111.1.217 > 10.111.1.206 [creds=present]
2016-06-27 16:04:19  INFO | migrating 1 instances
2016-06-27 16:04:19  INFO | [i-32080277] migration source initiating 10.111.1.217 > 10.111.1.206 [creds=present] (1 of 1 active outgoing migrations)
2016-06-27 16:04:19  INFO | [i-32080277] migrating instance
2016-06-27 16:04:19 ERROR | libvirt: Cannot get interface MTU on 'sg-298d11d1': No such device (code=38)
2016-06-27 16:04:19 ERROR | [i-32080277] cannot migrate instance, giving up and rolling back.
2016-06-27 16:04:19  INFO | [i-32080277] starting migration rollback of instance on source 10.111.1.217
2016-06-27 16:04:19  INFO | [i-32080277] migration source rolled back
2016-06-27 16:04:25  INFO | migrating 1 instances
2016-06-27 16:04:25 ERROR | [i-32080277] request to commit migration 10.111.1.217 > 10.111.1.206 when source migration_state='none' (not 'ready')
2016-06-27 16:04:25 ERROR | failed error=11
{noformat}
I am confused by these results. [~tsugawa], any ideas why only one mode is broken?

MANAGED maps SGs to VLANs, while NOVLAN does not. For each VLAN a linux bridge is created on NCs (in the case of NOVLAN, there is only one bridge).
Only the "active" SGs in each NC are created - i.e., if an NC does not host instance(s) of a SG, that SG (bridge) is not created. In live VM migration, an instance is hosted simultaneously (while in transit) by 2 NCs, but the instance metadata (from euca perspective) is only migrated once the live migration succeeds. This means that it is possible that the artifacts of the SG of the instance being migrated might not be in place on the destination NC. This is not a problem for NOVLAN since the necessary bridge is always present in all NCs.
One way to fix is to give up the optimization (of implementing strictly necessary bridges in NCs), and implement all active SGs (independently of being used or not in NCs) on all NCs.
Another possibility is to change the network broadcast to include the target NC as the host of the migrating instance.
Both approaches have high risk.

[~ccassler], [~shaon]'s quick migration tests indicate that euca-migrate-instances works in MANAGED-NOVLAN mode.
Given that this ticket is about migration (and not pack/unpack), perhaps there is a need for another ticket?

Error messages indicate problems with instance storage.

[~ccassler] this error has nothing to do with the network mode.

this is the problem.
Found local iqn= and local ip=10.111.5.165

This is found from /etc/iscsi/initiatorname.iscsi and the InitiatorName= string identifier.

Please create a new ticket and there should have been a better failure message when this condition is met. Ultimately there is something misconfigured with this environment.
I created this bug related to the error i saw above: EUCA-12579
Removed from 4.4.0 Known Issues - Managed Mode feature is removed.
